a.code: (game "GAVEL_game_0" (players 2) (equipment { (board (square 8) ) (piece "Marker" Each) }) (rules (play (move Add (to (sites Empty) if:(not (is In (to) (sites Around (last To) )) )) ) ) (end (if (or { (no Moves Next) (is Connected 3 SidesNoCorners) (is Connected 2 Corners) }) (result Mover Win)) ) ) )
a.rules: Players take turns placing markers of their colour on an 8x8 grid of square cells. It is not permitted to place a marker in any of the (up to) eight cells around the cell that a marker was last placed in by the opposing player. A player can win by connecting any pair of two corners of the board with a chain of their pieces, by connecting any three of the boards four sides (excluding corners), or by being the last player to make a legal move. Diagonal connections between markers also count for the purpose of establishing connections. This is a game generated by GAVEL. It appears to be primarily a mix of Havannah and Tabu Y, with novel elements.

It is a variant of Breakthrough/Knightthrough, with Draughts-like hopping of pieces, and no capture.") (rules "Played on an 8x8 board with one player starting with two rows of counters on one end of the board, and the opponent starting with two rows of counters on the opposite end of the board. Pieces can move by orthogonally or diagonally hopping over any single adjacent piece into an empty cell. There is no capture of pieces in this game. The first player to reach the opponent's edge of the board wins.") (version "1.3.12") (author "GAVEL") (credit "GAVEL") (date "2024") } ) 	 	(graphics { (board Style Chess) }) )
b.rules: Played on an 8x8 board with one player starting with two rows of counters on one end of the board, and the opponent starting with two rows of counters on the opposite end of the board. Pieces can move by orthogonally or diagonally hopping over any single adjacent piece into an empty cell. There is no capture of pieces in this game. The first player to reach the opponent's edge of the board wins. This is a game generated by GAVEL. It is a variant of Breakthrough/Knightthrough, with Draughts-like hopping of pieces, and no capture.

f.rules: Connect three pieces in a row to win.
